title: Machine Learning-Based Optimization for Corrosion Resistance Design of High-Entropy Alloy Coatings

context.prior_knowledge: Basic metallurgy and corrosion mechanism understanding, high school-level chemistry knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners are professionals requiring practical problem-solving skills; practical sessions utilize personal devices in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the relationship between the components of high-entropy alloy (HEA) coatings and their corrosion resistance.
Learners can apply a multi-objective optimization process using random forest models and genetic algorithms.
Learners can verify coating designs by analyzing corrosion potential (Ecorr) and pitting potential (Epit) data.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
